Member Login Join Get Certified Learn Making Spiritual Care a Priority The Spiritual Care Association (SCA) is the first multidisciplinary, international professional membership association for spiritual care providers that establishes evidence-based quality indicators , scope of practice , and a knowledge base for spiritual care. The  SCA Difference 1 MEMBERSHIP SCA Membership is a vital resource for professionals, clergy and organizations interested in spiritual care Learn More 2 EDUCATION SCA Learning Center with evidence-based curriculum Learn More 3 CERTIFICATION Nationally Recognized Chaplaincy Certification: Advanced Practice Board Certification (APBCC), Board Certification (BCC) and Credentialing (CC) Learn More MEMBERSHIP SCA Membership is a vital resource for professionals, clergy and organizations interested in spiritual care Learn More EDUCATION SCA Learning Center with evidence-based curriculum Learn More CERTIFICATION Nationally Recognized Chaplaincy Certification: Advanced Practice Board Certification (APBCC), Board Certification (BCC) and Credentialing (CC) Learn More What SCA Offers Members Engages and offers education to multiple interest groups, so more people in need receive effective spiritual care Opens access to new evidence-based knowledge base: Online Learning Center Provides valuable resources to contribute significantly to career development Creates a powerful voice for spiritual care Offers new paths for chaplaincy credentialing and board certification Learn More Membership Is Open to: All individuals and organizations committed to the delivery of optimal spiritual care, as a vital component of whole person care. We offer three categories of membership, with specialized sub-categories: Professional Membership For Chaplains, Clergy, Nurses, EMS and First Responders, Social Workers, and other Professionals Clergy Membership For Community Clergy and Religious Leaders Organizational Membership For Organizations and Institutions The Spiritual Care Association is the International Leader for all Spiritual Care Providers ﻿ ﻿ As the Spiritual Care Association continues to grow and expand, we continue to offer our members with highly-specialized services tailored to their particular industry. Through the SCA Divisions, we are able to provide our members a platform to network among themselves and access their specialized member benefits. What's New? Approval of HCPCS Codes for Chaplains The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid (CMS), a division of the US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), has for the first time, approved codes for chaplaincy and spiritual care. Click here to learn more! What's New? HealthCare Chaplaincy’s New Book Offers a Compiled Resource of Evidence-Based Research Join us for the 2024 Annual Caring for the Human Spirit Conference and Westberg Symposium on April 15-17, 2024. Click here to purchase. Approval of HCPCS Codes for Chaplains The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid (CMS), a division of the US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), has for the first time, approved codes for chaplaincy and spiritual care. Click here to learn more! Caring for the Human Spirit Conference and Westberg Symposium Join us for our 12th Annual Conference! Join us for the 2024 Annual Caring for the Human Spirit Conference and Westberg Symposium on April 15-17, 2024. Click here to learn more! The 2024 Foundations of Fatih Community Nursing Curriculum is now available for pre-sale! Click here to learn more! Provide Virtual Chaplaincy Services to Your Patients On demand. Every day. Member Login Job Opportunities The Spiritual Care Association is the perfect resource for employers looking for candidates in the area of chaplaincy and spiritual care, and for candidates seeking job opportunities. For Candidates Job opportunities are listed on our website as a free resource for chaplains, faith community nurses, CPE supervisors, and others seeking positions in the field of spiritual care. Job opportunities are posted by the potential employers themselves. Click on the link below to search through our job opportunities now. Find a Job For Employers The Spiritual Care Association welcomes your institution to post job openings in the areas of chaplaincy and spiritual care, faith community nursing, CPE supervision, and similar fields. Click on the link below for more information. Post a Job 500 Seventh Avenue, 8th Floor New York, NY 10018 (212) 644-1111 info@SpiritualCareAssociation.org CONNECT WITH US First Name * Last Name * Email (required) * Select list(s) to subscribe to HCCN eMail List Example: Yes, I would like to receive emails from Spiritual Care Association. What do you need: Search by location: Search Now Welcome to SoulSearch… We are a global community-driven platform designed to connect Spiritual Seekers with aligned and powerful Practitioners, Healers, and Teachers. Book one-on-one services, retreats & courses. Participate in online and in-person events such as our SoulSearch Enlightenment Expos. Engage in the enlightening & entertaining SoulSearchTV. Benefit from a variety of unique, signature experiences as we support one another on our SoulSearching journey. Join SoulSearch Today and expand your unique connection to all things Consciousness and Spirituality, all while finding and expanding your Tribe FIND PRACTITIONERS BY CATEGORY As a seeker, you can navigate through our website free of charge. If you are desiring to connect on a deeper level with specific experts, you may book one-on-one sessions, courses and retreats. Read More View All SoulSearch Client Testimonials Showcase Your Business Now! ☆ Life changing ☆ Kristi, and the Seven Rays of the Sun, have held tremendous space for my spiritual healing. I am forever grateful as these classes have transformed the course of my life and guided me to spiritually grow. Shadow work and processing unhealed emotional wounds have helped me find peace with my childhood and find forgiveness and unconditional love for my human journey. Kristi has helped me acknowledge the abusive relationship with my mother and given me the tools to keep going as a stronger individual. The teachings offer ancient out-of-this-world wisdom and insight. -Hailey ☆ Always Inspiring ☆ " Just want to say that working with Annie is always a delight. Mentor, teacher, and advisor... so very grateful for her skills and ability to connect with divine spirit (and her witty sense of humor). Through the years I have needed her council and teachings for all "life" situations, and I'm always amazed with the answer that come through. - Gay Danjou ☆ 5 out of 5 stars ☆ I have had three readings with Amanda and have come away from each one amazed at her gifts. The first thing I notice is her beautiful, warm and compassionate energy touching me, holding me in what feels like a Divine embrace. She sees all of you without judgment and helps you navigate even the most painful places in the most gentle way. Her messages come through like poetry. In the moment I may not always understand them, but when I look back at my notes, like poetry, more of their essence is revealed. She also offers practical, real-world advice to help you on your path. I would recommend her guidance to anyone in search of clarity or healing. I believe her to be a blessing to each life she touches. - Kristin ☆ Highly Skilled Team ☆ After taking classes for a few months,I feel confident recommending these two great guys. They are informative, gracious, highly skilled and a great team. I was very comfortable and allowed to grow in my work without feeling pressured and with incredible grace and encouragement. So grateful for their guidance. - Pam D. ☆ My inner Journey ☆ India, has helped me to start on a path inward to enlightenment. I met India in LHC in January for one of her workshops. I felt a connection with her immediately. My journey inward has  just begun, but I truly am in a great place, and India in a very short time has been a huge part of it. She is somebody I know that I can go to at anytime for guidance, questions or understanding. India will be a part of my journey where ever it takes me, she encourages one to follow their path and live with love for yourself and others. thank you, India for all you have done and will do to help me on my road inward! - Geno Why Join SoulSearch ? Introducing SoulSearch, home for our fellow Soul Travelers on their Soul Searching journey. We are your one-stop Consciousness platform, inviting you to embark on a journey of Self-Discovery and Personal Growth, with an array of features designed to enlighten, elevate, and expand your mind, body, and soul.  Our community is your gateway to connecting with healers and guides who can assist you along your spiritual path. At SoulSearch, you can explore a wide variety of resources, including one-on-one sessions, courses, events, and SoulSearch TV, all mindfully curated to assist you on your Journey toward Self-Awareness and Inner Peace. Delve into the wisdom of renowned experts, participate in transformative workshops, and explore a wide range of metaphysical topics. Within the safe space of the SoulSearch Community, you can connect with like-minded individuals on their unique path of Self-Discovery. Engage in meaningful discussions, seek advice, and share your experiences with a supportive community that understands the importance of personal growth and spiritual development. Plus, don't miss out on our Enlightenment Expos, where you can explore the metaphysical realms and connect with gifted intuitives and healers. Whether seeking guidance, healing, or a deeper understanding of the spiritual realm, SoulSearch has everything you need to embark on a soulful journey. Join the SoulSearch Community today and discover a world of enlightenment and transformation. Join Our Community GET ON OUR MAILING LIST Stay up to date on our latest offerings About Finding Spiritual & Energetic Healers & Guides is easy by searching our trusted network and being a part of our vibrant spiritual community! Website How It Works List Your Business Search Browse Categories Browse Locations Support Member Login Contact Us Spiritual & Energetic Healers & Guides - Get Listed Today © 2025 SoulSearch All Rights Reserved Terms of Use Privacy Policy

Naropa Healers Directory | Naropa University Skip to content Request Info Visit Campus Apply Now Donate My Naropa Search Academics Close Academics Open Academics Academics Contemplative education brings together the best of Western scholarship and Eastern world wisdom traditions. Therefore, your pursuit of wisdom at Naropa means learning both about academic subjects and about your own place in the world. This innovative approach places Naropa on the cutting edge of the newest and most effective methods of teaching and learning. & Aid If you’re seeking an education that resonates with both personal fulfillment and global impact, Naropa could be your top choice. At Naropa, you will experience a comprehensive curriculum that integrates the best of Eastern and Western educational approaches. Explore how Naropa can fuel your journey of intellectual and spiritual development. Admissions & Aid How to Apply Visit Naropa Alternative Ways to Attend Meet the Admissions Team Costs & Aid Housing & Residence Life Virtual Tour Accepted Student Checklist for Undergraduate Students Life at Naropa Close Life at Naropa Open Life at Naropa Life at Naropa Through its incredibly vibrant and welcoming community,  “Naropa offers a home for those who aren’t willing to conform to convention—the mystic, the healer, the prophet, the rebel, the artist, the revolutionary, the oddball—those who are incredible contributors to the evolution of society and of our planet.”—Core Associate Professor Zvi Ish-Shalom Follow Us Life at Naropa Student Handbook Student Support Wellness Student Accountability Career & Life Development Parent & Family Resources Living in Boulder Campus Safety Alumnx Relations The Naropa Difference Close The Naropa Difference Open The Naropa Difference The Naropa Difference How is Naropa different from other universities? At Naropa, a liberal arts education balances rigorous academics with powerful interpersonal skills and self-awareness to educate the whole person. Naropa’s contemplative approach is inspired by Buddhist philosophy and the conviction that we can build a diverse, contemplative, enlightened society when we have transformed education to affirm the basic goodness of every person. The Naropa Difference Naropa Magazine Pilot Light Blog Mindful U Podcast About Naropa Close About Naropa Open About Naropa About Naropa Located in Boulder, Colorado, Naropa University is a Buddhist-inspired, nonsectarian liberal arts university that is recognized as the birthplace of the mindfulness movement. Naropa offers undergraduate and graduate degree programs that emphasize professional and personal growth, intellectual development, and cultivating compassion. You can search this list by healing modalities and specialties, as well as other key words. Please note, this website is compiled from submissions directly given to Naropa University’s Office of Alumnx Engagement and contains a variety of resources, but is not intended to substitute or replace the professional medical advice you receive from your health care provider. The content provided here is for informational purposes only, and was not designed to diagnose or treat a health problem or disease. Please consult your health care provider with any questions or concerns you may have regarding your condition. We hope you find the information and links to other websites to be helpful, but please remember we do not control or endorse the information presented on these websites, nor do these sites endorse the information contained here. Naropa offers undergraduate and graduate degree programs that emphasize professional and personal growth, intellectual development, and cultivating compassion. Staff & Board - The Healing Trust About Us History, Mission, and Reports Staff & Board Our Commitment to Equity Grant Programs Eligibility Criteria Application Details & Deadlines Types of Grants Operating Grant Resilient Families Thriving Communities Strengthening Democracy Culture and Care Fund Sabbatical Fund Participatory Grantmaking Recipients Extra Goodies Our Advocacy Retreats and Self-Care Leadership Programs Internships FAQs Resources & Blogs Press Kit Contact Select Page STAFF & BOARD Meet Our Team Abby Siegel Hyman Program Partner for External Partnerships As the Program Partner for External Partnerships, Abby manages our work beyond grantmaking that supports the care and capacity of our grantees, including technical assistance and workshops, leadership circles, and Healing for the Healer retreats. She also manages our Culture and Care grant portfolio and the Sabbatical Fund. She is a member of our Communications Team. She can be found wherever there is coffee or chocolate. ➔ LEARN MORE abby.hyman@healingtrust.org LinkedIn Adell Neal Operations Director Adell Neal is the Operations Director at The Healing Trust. In this role, she manages The Trust’s operations, including financial administration, human resources and benefits administration, and she oversees the facility’s management and operating budget.  She loves trivia and is challenged daily when watching, Jeopardy!® episodes. ➔ LEARN MORE adell.neal@healingtrust.org LinkedIn Catherine Smith Program Partner Catherine is a Program Partner at The Healing Trust. In this role, Catherine directs our grantmaking activities in Bedford, Maury, and Rutherford Counties. She also manages some of our Mental Health and Abuse Prevention grants in Davidson County and advises on our advocacy work. An avid live music fan, Catherine and her husband enjoy going to music festivals and seeing obscure bands in divey places. ➔ LEARN MORE catherine.smith@healingtrust.org LinkedIn Diana Andrew Office and Events Manager Diana Andrew is the Office & Events Manager for The Healing Trust. She oversees the operation and maintenance of facilities, manages event logistics, and provides administrative support to the Board of Trust and CEO. She is passionate about sustainability and enjoys cooking and hosting loved ones. ➔ LEARN MORE diana.andrew@healingtrust.org LinkedIn Jennifer Oldham Vice President for Communications and Partnerships As the VP for Communications and Partnerships, Jennifer leads our communications team, supports the 37208 Participatory Grantmaking program, directs our equity work, and manages the Thriving Communities grants in Davidson County. Jennifer also manages the Resilient Families Violence Prevention and statewide grants and continues to set our communications strategy and public affairs work. She is an avid reader of fiction and creates art using a needle and thread. ➔ LEARN MORE jennifer.oldham@healingtrust.org LinkedIn Megan Davis Program and Communications Associate As the Programs and Communications Associate, Megan oversees the management of the grants database and provides support to the Trust’s grantmaking and programmatic initiatives. She also assists with developing social media communications across all platforms to reflect the Trust’s mission and vision. Megan has a background in public health and is passionate about improving health equity in Tennessee. In her free time, Megan is a self-proclaimed foodie and enjoys finding new restaurants in Nashville. ➔ LEARN MORE megan.davis@healingtrust.org LinkedIn Samuel Jackson President and CEO Samuel Jackson is the President and CEO of The Healing Trust. He works closely with our Board of Trust, oversees the fiscal and administrative operations of The Healing Trust, and works collaboratively with the program team. On the weekends, he can be found in his garage woodworking or on the sidelines coaching basketball. ➔ LEARN MORE samuel.jackson@healingtrust.org LinkedIn Sumita Keller Vice President of Programs and Advocacy As VP of Programs and Advocacy, Sumita oversees the grantmaking and internship programs and directly supports the Strengthening Democracy portfolio and the Thriving Communities, Resilient Families and Participatory Grantmaking portfolios in Montgomery County. She is also responsible for identifying and engaging in systems change advocacy opportunities alongside grantees. Sumita enjoys cheesy movies and is always up for a good game night. ➔ LEARN MORE sumita.keller@healingtrust.org LinkedIn Board of Directors Our mission is to support and partner with communities to advance racial equity and eliminate health disparities through advocacy and strategic investments. In 2025-2026, The Healing Trust’s board consists of 16 voting members and four non-voting community members. Of these 20 board members, 50% are under the age of 50, 65% identify as Black, Indigenous, or People of Color, and 25% live outside of Davidson County. Additionally, 30% identify as male and 70% identify as female. THE BOARD Dr. Hana Ali , Sumner County Democratic Party Chair, Healthcare Professional Rev.
